ygData.subject: Re: Exploring the windmills
ygData.msgSnippet: Honestly people, you think that we d have to kill an extremely high level NPC to get a tinkering book? No! And especially not on that is GOOD, and of our own
ygData.messageBody:
Honestly people, you think that we'd have to kill an extremely high level
NPC to get a tinkering book? No! And especially not on that is GOOD, and of
our own race! Thinking that it would be on someone like that is totally
rediculous and unlogical and insane even! Verant would honestly NEVER do
something like THAT, so you need to foregt it and start looking for more
logical answers. Gimblestan was the helper of the king, right? Maybe we need
to ask the king "Did you know Gimblestan?" Or something like that. There HAS
to be some kind of information somewhere about it, I think Verant meant
tinkering to be a lore related skill, so they wouldn't just A: shove the
book on some GOOD high level NPC, or B: put in in some weird place with no
kind of information pointing to it anywhere!


>Actually on the thought that someone said the gm claimed all the
>information
>was at the mills, I coaxed a lvl 49 druid to take out all of the npc's at
>the
>mills even the merchents for me as I healed him with my druid 8) they were
>very tough and we had to zone once as things went awry and we were both
>attacked by the guard there, they dropped nothing... nothing at all.... I
>cried that night... hard thinking I might have our answer and then come up
>empty. However, I have never seen Feddie Dooger and dont know about
>him.....
> charlotte was tough but not as tough as the npc with the elemental pet...
>he
>was nasty .... just so we can rule out a drop, unless it is a rare drop.
>That my friends would suk.
